title.rendered: Explain what is backbone.js ?

content.rendered:
Backbone.js is a JavaScript client-side (front end) framework, which helps to organize your code and makes it easier to develop single page applications.  It allows you to structure JavaScript code in an MVC  (Model, View , Controller) fashion

  • Model: It is a part of your code that populates  and retrieves the data
  • View: It is the HTML representation of this model
  • Controller:  It enables you to save your javascript application via a hashbang URl

excerpt.rendered: Backbone.js is a JavaScript client-side (front end) framework, which helps to organize your code and makes it easier to develop single page applications.  It allows you to structure JavaScript code in an MVC  (Model, View , Controller) fashion Model: It is a part of your code that populates  and retrieves the data View: It is the HTML […]

title.rendered: What are the main components of Backbone.js ?

content.rendered:
The main component of Backbone.js are

  • Model
  • View
  • Collection
  • Router
  • Event class object

excerpt.rendered: The main component of Backbone.js are Model View Collection Router Event class object

title.rendered: Explain what is Backbone.js collections ?

content.rendered: An ordered set of models are represented by Backbone.js collections. Any event in model will trigger an event in collection directly. For example, you can bind “change” event to be notified in a case when any model in the collection has been modified.

excerpt.rendered: An ordered set of models are represented by Backbone.js collections. Any event in model will trigger an event in collection directly. For example, you can bind “change” event to be notified in a case when any model in the collection has been modified.

title.rendered: Explain what is Backbone.js router is used for ?

content.rendered: Whenever an application want to change their URL fragment in order to provide bookmarkable and shareable URLs for an Ajax heavy application, backbone.js router is used.

excerpt.rendered: Whenever an application want to change their URL fragment in order to provide bookmarkable and shareable URLs for an Ajax heavy application, backbone.js router is used.

title.rendered: What is Backbone events ?

content.rendered: Backbone events is a module that can be mixed in to any object,  giving the object the ability to bind and trigger custom named events.  Events are not declared before they are bound to any object . Events reflects the state of the model.

excerpt.rendered: Backbone events is a module that can be mixed in to any object,  giving the object the ability to bind and trigger custom named events.  Events are not declared before they are bound to any object . Events reflects the state of the model.

title.rendered: What are the keypoints of Backbone ?

content.rendered:
• It has hard dependency with underscore.js to make it more functional and supporting a range of useful collection based operations
  • With jQuery it has a soft dependency
  • When the model changes it can update the HTML of your application automatically
  • It uses client-side rendering framework or Javascript templating to render html which avoid you to embed HTML code inside JavaScript code
  • For UI updates and DOM manipulations if offers a significantly clean and elegant way

excerpt.rendered: It has hard dependency with underscore.js to make it more functional and supporting a range of useful collection based operations With jQuery it has a soft dependency When the model changes it can update the HTML of your application automatically It uses client-side rendering framework or Javascript templating to render html which avoid you to […]

title.rendered: Why you have to use Backbone ? Advantages ?

content.rendered:
• By using JavaScript with the minimal set of data-structuring ( models & collections) and user interface (views & URLs) it enables you to develop a web application
  • Backbone is best useful to develop MVC like web applications, single page web applications or complex JavaScript web applications in an organized and structured manner without JavaScript code mixing with HTML
  • Provides key value binding and custom events
  • API with tons of functions
  • Robust event handling
  • API connetion over a RESTful JSON interface

excerpt.rendered: By using JavaScript with the minimal set of data-structuring ( models & collections) and user interface (views & URLs) it enables you to develop a web application Backbone is best useful to develop MVC like web applications, single page web applications or complex JavaScript web applications in an organized and structured manner without JavaScript code […]

title.rendered: What are the three js files that you require to setup a working environment for backbone?

content.rendered:
you are required following three js files to setup a working environment for backbone

  • jQuery
  • Backbone
  • Underscore

In your application put these files within js folder and use it in your index.html page

excerpt.rendered: you are required following three js files to setup a working environment for backbone jQuery Backbone Underscore In your application put these files within js folder and use it in your index.html page

title.rendered: Explain when you require Backbone.js ?

content.rendered:
Backbone.js is required in following condition

  • When developing a web application that requires a lot of JavaScript
  •  It is required when you want to give structure to your code, if your application needs to be scalable
  • Backbone is useful when a web application has to work with jQuery to traverse the DOM or give animations

excerpt.rendered: Backbone.js is required in following condition When developing a web application that requires a lot of JavaScript  It is required when you want to give structure to your code, if your application needs to be scalable Backbone is useful when a web application has to work with jQuery to traverse the DOM or give animations

title.rendered: Explain what is view in Backbone.js?

content.rendered:
Backbone view is a Javascript object that manages a specific DOM element and descendants.

  • Views are not HTML
  • It is a description of a model
  • The HTML code comes from templates
  • Works with any template system

excerpt.rendered: Backbone view is a Javascript object that manages a specific DOM element and descendants. Views are not HTML It is a description of a model The HTML code comes from templates Works with any template system

title.rendered: Explain what is Backbone.js Models?

content.rendered: Backbone.js models are object and core of backbone.js. It contains an array of attributes and listens for events. To represent your data, Backbone provides a model object. For example, you have a to do list, you would have a model representing each item on that list.

excerpt.rendered: Backbone.js models are object and core of backbone.js. It contains an array of attributes and listens for events. To represent your data, Backbone provides a model object. For example, you have a to do list, you would have a model representing each item on that list.

title.rendered: Explain how you can use backbone.js for multiple page web app ?

content.rendered:
For multiple page web app in backbone.js there are lots of consideration but here are two which can be useful

  • Serving the page : In this, where you want to have your web server route everything to the server route everything to serve the same static page. That means that everything in http://guru99.com/* will serve /var/www/guru99.com/index.html. once the static page is loaded, the JS on that page will decide what to do given the url
  • Push State : You can still use backbone routing to do your routing, but don’t use hashbangs.  This will allow you to navigate to URLs without actually needing a page refresh.

excerpt.rendered: For multiple page web app in backbone.js there are lots of consideration but here are two which can be useful Serving the page : In this, where you want to have your web server route everything to the server route everything to serve the same static page. That means that everything in http://guru99.com/* will serve /var/www/guru99.com/index.html. […]

title.rendered: Explain what is Modelbinder in Backbone.js ?

content.rendered: To make synchronization process of views and models together, ModelBinder class is used.

excerpt.rendered: To make synchronization process of views and models together, ModelBinder class is used.

title.rendered: What is the most powerful capabilities of the ModelBinder ?

content.rendered:
The most powerful capabilities of ModelBinder class is that it enables you to define scope when you create your bindings using jQuery.

  • If your views are simple, you can rely on default scoping rules that are based off of the html “name” attribute.
  • You can define scoping with jQuery selectors if your views are complex.

excerpt.rendered: The most powerful capabilities of ModelBinder class is that it enables you to define scope when you create your bindings using jQuery. If your views are simple, you can rely on default scoping rules that are based off of the html “name” attribute. You can define scoping with jQuery selectors if your views are complex.

title.rendered: Explain what is Converter in Backbone.js ?

content.rendered: A function is called when model’s attribute is copied to an html element or when an html element value is copied into a model’s attribute, this function is referred as Converter in Backbone.js

excerpt.rendered: A function is called when model’s attribute is copied to an html element or when an html element value is copied into a model’s attribute, this function is referred as Converter in Backbone.js

title.rendered: What is model.attributes ?

content.rendered: The attributes property is the internal hash containing the model’s state, usually a form of the JSON object representing the model data on the server. It is often a straightforward serialization of a row from the database

excerpt.rendered: The attributes property is the internal hash containing the model’s state, usually a form of the JSON object representing the model data on the server. It is often a straightforward serialization of a row from the database

title.rendered: What is the function of toJSON ?

content.rendered: It returns a shallow copy of the model’s attribute for JSON stringification. This function is used for persistence, serialization and for augmentation before being sent to the server. This does not return a JSON string

excerpt.rendered: It returns a shallow copy of the model’s attribute for JSON stringification. This function is used for persistence, serialization and for augmentation before being sent to the server. This does not return a JSON string

title.rendered: Explain when you can use Unbinding function in Backbone.js ?

content.rendered:
When you want to remove the validation binding on the model or all models , removing all events hooked up on the collection, you can use Unbinding function.

For example : Backbone.Validation.Unbind(view)   [ This will remove the validation binding]

excerpt.rendered: When you want to remove the validation binding on the model or all models , removing all events hooked up on the collection, you can use Unbinding function. For example : Backbone.Validation.Unbind(view)   [ This will remove the validation binding]

title.rendered: What are the configuration options available ?

content.rendered:
The configuration options available are

  • InitialCopyDirection
  • modelSetOptions
  • change Triggers
  • boundAttribute
  • suppressThrows
  • converter

excerpt.rendered: The configuration options available are InitialCopyDirection modelSetOptions change Triggers boundAttribute suppressThrows converter

title.rendered: Mention what are the typical problems you might face with the Backbone view code ?

content.rendered:
• Application models don’t change very often
  • Application pages are frequently refreshed from scratch from the server
  • Between different view models are not shared

excerpt.rendered: Application models don’t change very often Application pages are frequently refreshed from scratch from the server Between different view models are not shared
